text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The response clearly distinguishes between jurisdictional review and merits review. Under the section 'Defending Against Jurisdictional Challenges,' it discusses the tribunal's authority to decide its own jurisdiction ('Kompetenz-Kompetenz') and the narrow scope of judicial review over that determination, which directly addresses the jurisdictional review aspect. While the primary focus shifts to due process (Article V(1)(b)), the initial section explicitly separates the jurisdictional challenge from the substantive merits, satisfying the requirement to distinguish between these two types of review.", "criterion_id": "e92f1752-19b6-4afc-9ea1-4277c9bf6cc0"}
